alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued November 15 at 9:48PM EST until November 16 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THURSDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THURSDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves up to 6 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding. * WHERE...Coastal Franklin County. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 1 PM EST Thursday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Thursday night. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from noon today to 7 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor coastal flooding is possible. Up to 2.5 feet of inundation is possible on normally dry ground near the shoreline. The high tide of greatest concern will come late tonight.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
